page.title: 07Todwick Grange.
page.content: {Todwick Grange}is a big house on the outskirts of Todwick built between 1860 and 1870 for a wealthy person. It was once a granary for{Roche Abbey together with{Brancliffe Grange. During repair work old doors were found which could have been part of a Victorian house. The house remained a private house belonging to different people until 1947 when it was bought by the Coal Board to use as headquarters. They needed drawing offices so the school was built as drawing rooms and it had lots of windows for light. The house went up for sale and was bought by {Sheffield {Childrens Department}for children who can't live at home.Children who live there can't go to a{Sheffield }school so they turned the drawing rooms into a school. There are 30 beds and 20 of them are being used.
